text: Helen Murray Free (February 20, 1923 â€“ May 1, 2021) was an American chemist and educator. She is most known for creating many self-testing systems for diabetes and other diseases while working at Miles Laboratories. She helped create dip-and-read strips, which are still used to this day. Free died on May 1, 2021, at a hospice facility in Elkhart, Indiana from problems caused by a stroke, aged 98. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Scientists from Pittsburgh Category:American chemists Category:American inventors Category:Deaths from stroke
title: Helen Murray Free
